pythagorean.desc: Western numerology system based on Greek mathematician Pythagoras
pythagorean.notes: Most commonly used system in Western numerology

chaldean.desc: Ancient Babylonian numerology system with different letter values
chaldean.notes: Older system that doesn't use 9, focuses on 1-8

kabbalah.alphabet_rule: Hebrew alphabet values: Aleph=1, Bet=2, Gimel=3, Dalet=4, He=5, Vav=6, Zayin=7, Chet=8, Tet=9, Yod=10, Kaf=20, Lamed=30, Mem=40, Nun=50, Samekh=60, Ayin=70, Pe=80, Tzadi=90, Qof=100, Resh=200, Shin=300, Tav=400
kabbalah.notes: Based on Hebrew gematria and mystical traditions

tamil.desc: South Indian numerology system with regional variations
tamil.notes: Regional system used in Tamil-speaking regions

chinese.desc: Chinese numerology based on symbolic meanings and sounds
chinese.alphabet_rule: Based on Chinese characters and their symbolic meanings, not alphabetical values
chinese.notes: Focuses on symbolic meanings rather than numerical calculations

vedic.desc: Indian Vedic numerology linked to Jyotish astrology
vedic.alphabet_rule: Linked to planetary influences: A=1 (Sun), B=2 (Moon), C=3 (Jupiter), D=4 (Rahu), E=5 (Mercury), F=6 (Venus), G=7 (Ketu), H=8 (Saturn), I=9 (Mars)
vedic.notes: Integrates with Vedic astrology and planetary influences
